articles.title: About this site

articles.title: COVID-19 Cases/Vaccinations Examination
articles.description: An Examination of COVID-19 data in China, Canada, United States, and United Kingdom.
articles.contents:
Visualization Graphs below visually demonstrate the recent data about case and vaccination situations in China, Canada, United States, and United Kingdom. Weekly Cases The graph below demonstrates current data of weekly COVID-19 cases in China, Canada, United States, and United Kingdom starting from Feburary 2020. Analysis According to the graph, China did significantly better than the other countries on controlling the spread of virus because the line representing Chinaâ€™s data is constantly at a level that is around 0%. An interesting point to note is that Canada, United Kingdom, and United states all have a peak during January 2021, and it could represent that virus or social communication is most active during that time period. Source: Our World in Data Analysis According to the graph, China and Canada have a constantly positive trend of vaccination progress, whereas United Kingdom fluctuates frequently starting from February. The trend in United States is dramatic since the number of vaccination grew consistently before mid-April, but it began to drop intensely after that.
